questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: Be more comfortable using R for various task, in a open, skillful, reproducible, and organized way

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: Become more efficient in my data management and analysis in R

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: I expect the intermediate course to be very applied, so that I am able to upload my own datasets into R and start to use R for my statistical analysis

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: I expect to be able to handle large data sets, effectively making them accesible to analysis. Also to improve my R skills in general and get better coding habits

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: I expect to get a more lean workflow in R and get good habits in data wrangling/tidying.

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: I expect to improve my R knowledge and become better in organizing my projects with R

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: I expect to learn how to import and analyze the scientific data in R.

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: I expect to learn the principles of how to use R, making me able to do perform data management of my own raw data in R.

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: I expect to learn the required fundamental concepts, techniques, and skills needed for processing and managing data in a reproducible and well-documented way.After completing the course, I would be able to create pipelines that get, process, and clean my data efficiently, write reproducible codes for future use to myself and my collaborators and colleagues.

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: I expect to learn the tools that can provide me some skills to analyse my own data.

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: I hope to get a better understanding of how to organize my data analysis, so it will be easier for me to go back and know, what I have done and why. I would like to be able to set up good markdowns for the data analysis used for publications.

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: I hope to learn enough R to be comfortable to use it in my own research

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: I want to improve my data handling/processing skills with R, so I can start my analysis.

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: I would like to be better at using R markdown and improve my documentation/reproducibility when using R. I would also like to be more fluent in coding.

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: I would like to understand how to write functions and use that afterwards for my daily data analysis, because I am tired of repeating codes. Moreover, I would like to use R projects and learn how to better document my data processing, so other colleages and me (after some time of not working on this project) can easier understand my programmes. Moreover, I would like to learn how to enhance my data processing and also use it for other datasets.

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: I would like to use R for all my data management, statistical analyses and making figures.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: I had trouble with getting started (see command here below) - the pop-up window did not come up, and I was super frustrated and ended up using over an hour on google to figure out how to fix it. questions: Please describe the problems you've had.
responses: I attempted to use git (taking into account the lessens of the beginners course). During the committing step, Git wanted to save all my desktop files (also personal ones) and did not confine to the R project. Not sure why, as I followed the guide very closely. Manually deselecting each private file crashed R during multiple tries.

questions: Please describe the problems you've had.
responses: I encountered several problems. Initially I experienced problems with incompatible versions/updates of R, Rstudio and Rtools. I fixed that problem by using an older version of Rtools. Another problem I faced was related to a package I did not have installed. In that case Google helped me :)

questions: Please describe the problems you've had.
responses: In the beginning some of the codes did not work - it was related to updating to the newest version of Rtools. Problem solved.
